statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Miami 94, Pepperdine 59
article.story: CORAL GABLES, Fla. -- Malcolm Grant scored 22 points to lead Miami to a 94-59 victory over Pepperdine on Thursday night. Grant and teammate Durand Scott nearly missed the game because their flights to Miami were delayed for three days. They could not leave their homes in the Northeast because of the blizzard which hit the region Sunday. The Hurricanes guards expected to return to Miami on Sunday following a short Christmas break but arrived in Miami Thursday afternoon, four hours before tipoff. Miami (11-3) never trailed as Grant hit three early 3-pointers to help the Hurricanes build a 27-13 lead with 8:43 remaining in the first half. The Waves (5-11) reduced the margin with a 10-2 run in the next 4:05. Keion Bell's two free throws capped the spurt and cut Miami's lead to 29-23 with 4:38 left. Miami responded with 12 points behind 3-pointers from Scott and Adrian Thomas. Thomas' 3-pointer with 49 seconds left in the half increased the Hurricanes' lead to 43-23. Scott's 3-point play widened Miami's lead to 62-31 with 11:38 remaining in the second half. The Hurricanes had their largest lead, 82-42, after Raphael Akpejiori's two free throws with 5:24 left. Grant was one of four Hurricanes who scored in double figures. Scott finished with 15 points and Reggie Johnson scored 12 points and grabbed a career-high 15 rebounds. Erik Swoope scored 11 of his 13 points in the second half. Mychel Thompson led the Waves with 15 points. Miami will begin its Atlantic Coast Conference schedule Sunday at defending national champion Duke. Pepperdine returns home for a nonconference game against Seattle on Sunday before opening its West Coast Conference schedule with a home game against San Diego Jan. 6
